meanings.sent1: The existential question of whether we are alone in the universe puzzled the scientists.
meanings.sent2: She had an existential crisis when she realized the fragility of life.
meanings.sent3: The existential dread of running out of chocolate chip cookies haunted him.
meanings.sent4: His paintings captured the existential angst of modern society.
meanings.sent5: The existential threat of climate change loomed large over the planet.

meanings.definition: Concerned with existence, especially human existence
meanings.sent1: The movie explored deep existential themes about the meaning of life.
meanings.sent2: He had an existential conversation with his friend about the purpose of their existence.
meanings.sent3: The existential joy of watching a sunrise filled her heart with warmth.
meanings.sent4: The artist's work delved into the existential struggles of ordinary people.
meanings.sent5: The existential struggle to find one's place in the world is a common human experience.

meanings.definition: Denoting or relating to a philosophical theory emphasizing the existence of the individual person as a free and responsible agent
meanings.sent1: The existential philosophy class discussed the concept of personal freedom.
meanings.sent2: She found solace in the existential belief that she had control over her own destiny.
meanings.sent3: The existential humor in the movie made everyone laugh at life's absurdities.
meanings.sent4: His writing reflected an existential view of the world where individuals shape their own reality.
meanings.sent5: The existential responsibility of making choices weighed heavily on his mind.
